result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas J Haber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.
Concurrent with: 14CF239

miscConds.notes: Bond posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or combination thereof to equal full time.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant shall not be present where known drug users are present or where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.

Defendant shall not have any cash jobs or self-employment.

Defendant shall not possess any weapons.

Defendant shall have no contact with Michael K-J.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid license, insurance and registration.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections monthly.  

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.  

Defendant shall inform the probation agent within 24 hours of any prescription change.

Defendant shall submit to random drug screens.

Defendant shall provide proof of all incoming and outgoing money through check stubs and receipts.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lucas J Haber
